alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 22 at 9:38AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following areas, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall may lead to excessive runoff over recent wildfire burn scars such as the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon and Cooks Peak scars. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Wildfire burn scars and areas that received heavy rainfall on Thursday will be especially vulnerable to excessive runoff and flash flooding. - https://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
